q1.title: What do you most want to do first after arriving in Australia?

options.1: Find a place in your school or city where you can study or work on your own projects
options.2: Can't wait to join the school's orientation activities and meet new friends
options.3: Search for job opportunities near your home
options.4: Explore the city and find interesting places to visit

q2.title: How would you like to spend an ordinary weekend?

options.1: Stay at home to finish assignments or review coursework
options.2: Join various activities or gatherings with friends
options.3: Work, especially if there's double pay on weekends
options.4: Go out and have fun; surfing, fishing, or running

q3.title: What would you do if you don't understand the class content?

options.1: Immediately seek additional learning resources, like consulting the teacher or getting tutoring
options.2: Form a study group with classmates to discuss and solve the problem together
options.3: Ask classmates or solve it quickly by yourself; it's okay if it's not perfect, but work must be done
options.4: Take a break to relax before tackling the problem again

q4.title: After class, a friend invites you to eat nearby. What would you do?

options.1: Maybe not this time, I have another class later, I'll go home to prepare
options.2: Why not! Hanging out with friends is more fun than attending class
options.3: Sure, but I might have to leave early because I have work later
options.4: No problem! Should we catch a movie after eating?

q5.title: If your school offers an internship opportunity, how would you choose?

options.1: Study hard to enhance professional knowledge and improve grades
options.2: Choose an internship related to interpersonal skills to expand your social circle
options.3: Choose an internship that enhances workplace skills and offers compensation
options.4: Choose an internship that balances work and travel

q6.title: How would you plan for the upcoming long holiday in two weeks?

options.1: Finally, I have time to catch up on all my coursework and even get ahead on future classes
options.2: It's finally a break, I want to hang out and eat with friends
options.3: See if there's any work shifts available; if not, I'll just rest at home
options.4: No classes? Then I definitely want to travel to another city and have fun!

q7.title: The due date for your report is next Monday, but a friend invites you to go out this weekend. How would you respond?

options.1: Sorry guys, I need to go home and prepare, I'm really running out of time
options.2: I never miss a friend's invite; I'll prepare for the finals after we come back
options.3: Let me check if I have work; if not, I'll join you
options.4: Let's go! I have a few places in mind I want to visit

q8.title: On the first day of class, the teacher says there will be a group project. How would you choose your group members?

options.1: I want to team up with classmates who seem serious and responsible
options.2: Of course, I'll team up with friends or classmates I get along with; it's a chance to bond while working on the project
options.3: Priority goes to classmates with work experience or who are reliable, so we can complete the project efficiently, leaving me more time for work
options.4: I want to team up with fun and easy-going people; the project might be boring, but the process should be enjoyable!

q9.title: What would you do if you find yourself falling behind in class?

options.1: I'll probably spend the next week glued to my computer, catching up on everything I've missed
options.2: Ask others how they're doing and seek their advice
options.3: Oh no, this is dangerous; I might need to take fewer work shifts to catch up
options.4: Don't stress too much, get a bubble tea to relax first, then catch up on the coursework

q10.title: When friends invite you to join a school club, how would you respond?

options.1: I'll check if the club is related to my studies; if it helps enhance my professional knowledge, I'll consider joining
options.2: Of course, I'll join! Club activities are a great way to make new friends and expand my network
options.3: If the club's schedule doesn't conflict with my work, I'll consider joining; it's important to balance work and life
options.4: If the club activities are fun, I'll join. It's a good way to relax!

q11.title: What do you do when you feel homesick?

options.1: Focus on my studies and try to keep myself busy, so I don't dwell too much on missing home
options.2: Hang out, eat, drink, and chat with friends to alleviate homesickness
options.3: Work harder, stay positive, and start planning my next visit home
options.4: Find some food from home or listen to music to relax

q12.title: How do you handle meeting classmates from different cultures?

options.1: I would first observe and understand their cultural background and interact with them respectfully
options.2: Actively share cultures with classmates from different backgrounds and invite them to hang out, building friendships quickly
options.3: Try to find common interests and look for possible cooperation opportunities, leveraging the advantages of different cultures
options.4: Take a relaxed approach to cultural differences, and try to find interesting aspects of their culture, making the interaction more enjoyable

q13.title: What action do you take after seeing a group for international students in Australia?

options.1: I find some content about Australian schools interesting, so I follow it
options.2: I see regular gatherings being held, so I follow it and might join to meet new friends
options.3: It's a sub-community for Australian professionals with relevant resources, so I follow it for long-term benefits
options.4: Everything about the content and the people seems fun, so I definitely want to follow and participate in their activities!

Result.subscribeTitle: Subscribe to First-hand News for International Students in Australia!
Result.promoteTitle: Welcome to Join the International Students in Australia Community!
